text:
The restaurant is located inside Caesars Palace all the way in the back near Mesa Grill. 
We ordered the following:
-Lt. Dan; an alcoholic ice tea lemonade perfect for those who like strong herbal tea flavors. 
-Snake in the grass;  a classic mojito with lots of mint. 
-Pan Seared Scallops with Couscous and Citrus Sauce;  three jumbo size scallops cooked to tender perfection on a bed of couscous with pesto and citrus sauce. The  couscous was delicious and blends very well with the thick pesto sauce; however, there was that additional sweet and sour like sauce  that the boyfriend and I weren't fond of because it didn't add to anything.   

-The Porkbutt with whiskey apples and bacon emulsion was the most popular and recommended dish, but had mixed reactions from us. I'll admit the pork was so tender, so moist,  and practically melted in our mouths, but I found the porkbutt and bacon emulsion too salty and overwhelming. If you love salty foods like the boyfriend, then this is a must try dish.  I do love the whiskey apples which added a crunchy texture and pickled flavor to combat the salty and fatty porkbutt. 

Overall, it was a good experience and we will definitely come back to try the duck next time.

This place is insanely good. Great food, great bar and awesome atmosphere. 

Highly recommended!!

I LOVE their brussel sprouts with walnuts. I would go back and just order that as a meal. As my entree, I ordered the flank steak. It was good, but I would probably order and try something else. It was nothing special. They said the pork butt was a popular dish.

5 stars for customer service. Our waiter was amazingly awesome. 

I will definitely come back the next time I'm in town.

Our server was quite attentive until we only ordered 3 appetizers, a soda and a beer (for 2). Then he seemed annoyed and virtually disappeared. 
The food was great and our "small bites" meal was still $60.

I recently moved to Vegas this year so I blindly started to find my way around this 24 hour city.. it being the Mecca of gourmet restaurants, I've been excited to explore the culinary side of the strip. I play poker at various casinos but Caesars has been my recurring spot lately. I found Searsucker a few weeks ago and being new to yelp, I realized I could express my experience publicly as the appreciation is properly due. This causal fine dining restaurant falls nothing short to to expectation. They combine a sports like atmosphere with the TV's at the bar and an almost California rustic lay out. The pretty blonde bartender was the most funny, entertaining person. I made a few friends at the bar because she interacted with all of us together, it's actually a pretty amazing talent to give multiple people so much comfortability and attention that it breaks down that awkward barrier everyone has these days, especially with technology in the way. Bars are meant for that. To pull someone away from their phone and space bubble is hard to do. She honestly illuminates that bar with her personality and it shows. All the bartenders helped guide me through the menu and I ended up devouring the recommendations. I like the simple fact that their menu has causal bar food as well as upscale selections with a twist. The frenched lollipop wings, bone marrow and brussels sprouts were outstanding. I wish I could have ordered the calamari and shishito peppers but I will have to wait until next time. Overall the dishes and service were memorable. The way Vegas should be.

Place is not worth the price. Way over priced food and drinks. Place has a strange atmosphere and customer service was truly lacking. It takes you forever to get your order in and to get anyones attention. Their menu is difficult to understand and servers are wasting time explaining everything to customers. High end restaurant pricing with casual environment. Save your money and go elsewhere for the money you will drop here.  Very disappointed for the owner to be a winner of Top Chef.  What a let down.  Walk around the corner from this place in the Casino to Bobby Flay's, you will be 100X better off for the same price if not lower.

Fabulous!
Excellent service. Excellent food. 
Servers really know the menu. Go for the drinks or the food, or (I recommend) both. 
Signature drinks are worth your while and then some...but the food...oh my. So good! 
The beet salad says it all:  simple, yet fantastic. The goat cheese balls make even the non-salad fan happy. 
I have no favorites, it was allllll good. 
We had an assortment of "smalls" (appetizers) and entrees and even dessert...each one was superb.  I'm especially a fan of the Squid "Sweet Heat".  Visually intriguing and the taste was appealing!  The bavette "flank" was perfection.

Fun atmosphere, kind of like a high end dive bar. Food was invigorating, lots of flavor with ever bite. Fish tacos were great and so was the iced tea lemonade cocktail. The Chef was going around greeting everyone and chatting at tables for all those top chef fans out there.

Our server was so exceptional. Dez, my wife was not feeling well when we arrived and by the time we left Dez had cheered her up and pampered her so much she was in much better spirits. We will defiantly be back, the food was great as well.

Frustrating with the manager as they told us that this place is full but wasn't even full and force us pay 60 per person


Poor management and will not return.  Brought over 18 customers.  Thanks for providing horrible experience at the end.

We recently had dinner at Searsucker at Caesar's Palace. Never having visited any of their locations, I was a little nervous about their over-emphasis on "social dining" -  sorry, I'm not interested in making new friends during dinner - but, honestly, I didn't notice this in action at the restaurant; we had a four-top for the 4 of us and from what I could see, each group dining had their own space. So that was a relief.

I had no expectations going in and was really very, very pleased with everything we order, from the cocktails to the apps and entrees. We eat a lot in Vegas, like most people, and have eaten both at medium and high end restaurants in that city. For us, particular standouts were the eggs + bacon "pork belly", with pork that I swear melted in your mouth, it was so tender, and my loin "filet" (not sure why they love to put words in quotes so much...), with lobster butter + mushroom demi glace.  

Even though this is a positive review, I do need to add one negative note. Here's what drove me crazy about Searsucker: They have a bathroom attendant in both the men and women's bathroom. In this modern day and age, there is absolutely no f*&#ing reason to have an individual in a bathroom whose sole purpose is to hand you a paper towel, and to be tipped for doing so. But what makes it worse here is that, at least the men's bathroom, is TINY- there is only ONE vanity sink, hemmed in a very small area and this tuxedo-clad attendant (who, upon my entry, startled me by yelling "Hey, Boss! Welcome to the Men's Room!") and I had to awkwardly jockey for position in front of it, with him adding value to his service by waving his hand in front of the faucet motion sensor to get my tap started. It's completely ridiculous, awkward and uncomfortable and I know several of us at our table were actually painfully putting off trips to the bathroom just to avoid it. So, if you are reading this Searsucker, ditch the ridiculous bathroom attendants!

But otherwise, we were really very pleased with drinks, food and service. Vegas has too many great places to eat for me to promise to make it back here, but I also wouldn't complain if that ended up happening.
Inside Caesar's Palace. Really nice atmosphere. Great wait staff. A good island of casual calm inside the loud hustle and bustle of the casino. Yummy bites too!!
The crab and avocado spread was delicious; skilled bartenders; I personally didn't enjoy the grass-fed strip steak because it was tough on the outside

I've been to the Searsucker in San Diego which is amazing so I had high expectations.  Overall, the Vegas Searsucker was only ok.  I think they are still trying to work out their preparation since it's new.  We started with a Ballerina and the Czar cocktail which was amazing.  We had the farm bird lollipops and they were very flavorful.  The shrimp and bacon grits dish was over sauced and the hot sauce flavor was so strong you couldn't taste the bacon.  The mahi mahi was overcooked and had the consistency of chicken.  The short ribs were excellent as was the strawberry and champagne vinegrette salad.  The warm chocolate chip cookies were absolutely to die for.  They bring a cup of cold milk for dipping.

I was excited to try this location of Seersucker, since the San Diego location is fun!  However, I would have to say my meal was probably in top 5 grossest things I've ever had in a restaurant and I've had Mexican food in London!  If rating on just my main dish, I would have given zero stars, the 2-star rating is because the place itself is nice and our waiter was pleasant.  For the main dish, both my friend and I ordered the quinoa.  I want to say that I love quinoa dishes and order them frequently around town.  I have always loved them which is why I thought the roasted vegetables and quinoa here would be delicious!  IT WAS NOT.  It was gross - basically soggy tasting dirt.  There was a big mound of really wet quinoa, not flavored at all except for the gross dirt taste, a couple sliced sweet potatoes (that were kind-of hard and just tasted plain) and there might have been a couple slivers of kale.  I kept trying to take some more bites, thinking it couldn't be so gross as I thought, but finally I had to give up.  My friend also thought it tasted gross.  I was kind of surprised the waiter didn't say anything when he took our plates, since both were almost completely untouched, he didn't even ask if we liked it.  Not that I expected anything - I obviously made a bad choice, but thought it was weird all the same.  I will not be coming back here.  I think they should be embarrassed to serve such a bad dish.  For the money we spent I really expected something great or at least edible, not soggy dirt.  Gross!
Duck fat fries were okay. The pork butt was very good. My husband steak and the Mac and cheese were over salted. Waiter was decent but pushing the up sell on everything.

Expected everything in Vegas to be overpriced... but undersized portions with terrible service? Only at this location. We have these back home in San Diego and they're always great. Our server treated us like crap because we were savvy to their happy hour menu. We still ordered off the regular and he treated us with such hostility. We ended up paying another $100 at a different restaurant to get what we wanted

Awesome ambiance! Took them a minute to find our reservation and get the table ready, but not a big deal. Our group of 5 shared several small plates.

Our group's favorite:
Bussel sprouts
Short rib
Squid
Mushroom burrata french toast
Shrimp ceviche (so good and very different!)
Duck fat fries

Skip:
Mussels

Dessert:
Ermagahd is delicious
Smores is ok

Great waiter and very very attentive service. Would definitely recommend to a friend!

Brought my wife out for a Vegas vacation.  We don't gamble so food is an important part of this vacation.  Searsucker exceeded my expectations as a foodie!

We were here to see Absinthe and didn't want a huge meal so we went with the small plates.  We did the Tuna Poke, Duck Fat Fries, Scallop special, and S'mores desert.

Each dish was excellent and easily filled us up.  We will come back once more before we leave

A new place at Caesars palace right beside the new nightclub Omnia. Its a casual but above average restaurant, with both tables and bar seatings available. If you are by the bar, you can watch sports and ppl passing through the casino for fun.

Quality is also above average and affects pricing which will leave you around $30 for a main. Service is quick and in line with the concept overall, and handles your requests with a smile.

The decor inside gives a cool atmosphere and the open kitchen sets the right ambience for the room. Even though it can be a sports bar, you may not wanna go here if you want to combine a quick bite(read cheap bite) with sports. 

I would instead consider this as a new fresh restaurant, where even though you agreed having dinner out, can get away with sneaking in some sports and still leave the place with a ring on your finger.

Started the meal with the calamari, which was one of the best I've ever had. Had the short rib as my main and it was melt in your mouth, cut with a spoon tender, and packed full of flavor. Our waitress was very attentive and gave us excellent service. The cocktails and atmosphere were a bit lacking.

Whoohoooo!! I hesitate to give this place 5 stars because it was so easy for me to get a reservation here, I don't want others to know about this gem of a restaurant.

But I shall share with you all my enthusiasm for this place. The food is unpretentious, well, at least by new American cuisine standards. Having recently dined at fellow Top Chef contestant Richard Blais' restaurant (Juniper & Ivy in San Diego) where I found the food to be very fun and creative, but lacking heart and taste/satisfaction, Chef Brian Malarkey's restaurant really knocked it out of the park for me. The food is simple, and instead of getting fancy, they focused on just preparing the food perfectly. 

Of note, their duck breast confit was perfectly prepared. Not a single complaint. Even the bed of white beans it sits on top of was delicious, and I haaaaaate beans! Their scallop dish is priced a bit on the high side, but they give you three very decent-sized scallops, and again, it was made perfectly.

You must try their sweet and spicy squid. Even if you're not a fan of squid, this dish totally won me over. I don't know how they prepare it but the squid is not chewy at all. It's got a great texture that reminds me of scallops. Anyway you must try it. 

The only disappointing dish was the short rib. Ugh. If I see short rib on one more menu I'm gonna scream, but the waiter recommended it. It was dry, bland, and boring. It even sat on top of a pile of boring mashed potatoes. Avoid this one. 

I will definitely be back again!
What a fun place! Everything from the service to the food was amazing. The overall atmosphere was so lively i will definitely be back to dine on my next trip to vegas!

Went here without know what to expect, ended up with a new favorite spot.  I was a bit hesitant to go here, because Old Homestead is my absolute favorite restaurant and its literally around the corner from Searsucker.  I decided to change things up a bit and try this brand new spot at Caesars.  Started off with the eggs + bacon "pork belly"and it was outstanding, I highly suggest it, as it's quite a difference from your normal appetizer. Me and my mother split the tomahawk with a side of bacon grits, and I have to say this steak was unbelievable.  Was it as good as Homestead's ribeye?  Obviously this stuff is subjective, and I'm biased towards them,  but I'll definitely say it's up there, and a bit better than STK's ribeye.  Honestly one of the top 10 meals I've ever had, and we didn't even do dessert.

Was in Vegas for business and had the pleasure of dining at Searsucker last Saturday night.  We had a 7:00 reservation and although the place was packed when we arrived we were seated right away at a really cozy table at the back of the restaurant.

Our server was really helpful and made some great recommendations.  We started with the warm spinach salad, which was absolutely delicious.  The hubby had the swordfish with a side of Cauliflower and I had the shrimp with a side of corn.  Everything that came out was flavorful and perfectly cooked.  My husband said it was the best fish he's ever had. Only regret is that we totally cleaned our plates and didn't have room to try any of the desserts.

Overall the experience was really great.  Good service without being pretentious, good drinks, and excellent food.  Will definitely come back next time we're in town.

Everything about this place is awesome!  Great vibe from the people and the food is delicious!! Definitely recommend the Bone Marrow to start and end with the Hanger steak. This place is the real deal!

My absolute favorite restaurant in Vegas!  Great cocktails and food. The mango mai Tai is a treat. Love this place so much we came back the next night!  You can get oysters by the piece, they come with a pomegranate mignonette that pairs so well with the creamy oysters. The biscuits with butter and bourbon infused honey are delish. The steak tartare was creative and tasty. I had the bone marrow the second night and it was amazing!  Perfectly cooked and the sweetness balanced the slight bitterness of the crispy Brussels sprouts. The staff was attentive and knowledgeable - the manager came by the table each night to make sure we were happy with our food. I highly anticipate my next visit to Vegas so we can eat there again!
One of the best Restaurant week experiences I've had the pleasure of experiencing.  Must gets:  Bone Marrow app and Short Rib Main.  The cookie sandwich was also delish!

Was going for shared plates menu. 6 person group with sometimes overlapping tastes. Menu offered nice selection of choices. Had 6 or 7. Ordered large plate of short rib. Prob favorite of group. Not sure why it wasn't busier since felt the food choices, quality and atmosphere and ultimately the location were 4 to 5 ratings in each category. Service was very attentive. If only had short time would recommend as food started arriving within couple of minutes.

Had Thanksgiving Dinner here yesterday. Our waitress Desiree was amazing. The food was fabulous.  But the reason I did not give them 5 stars is because the food was barely warm and the second on dressing was burnt. They did not offer to adjust anything. I did ask for hot gravy to warm up the dressing and meThey also charged extra for biscuits.  Overall it was a good experience.  Our first time here. Also finding the restaurant in Caesars was a Maze. There are no directions for the restaurant. Good luck if you go.
Tammy pointed out our order and right off the bat was amazing. Jeasus made us super cozy and the food was to die for. I had the strawberry  salad, shrimp and grits and  crab cake. All me. All good.

So I was in Vegas with the weekend planned...UNTIL SS!!! We went to SS with a group of friends, and my first gripe is the fact that they don't allow outside drinks. Yep, toss that Fat Tuesday out! Its Vegas and for a pretty pricey-not so amazing- restaurant the "no outside drink" rule is obnoxious. Second and even worse, my beau got the FISH and CHIPS and GOT FOOD POISONING as a result! I think his meal was not only around $30-40 but then it made him very very sick. And he got sick to the point where we had to cut the rest of our Vegas plans short because he had to be treated for his food poisoning. And NO, HE DOESNT DRINK SO IT WAS NOT ANY REACTION TO ALCOHOL! Third, I was at a table with about 14 people and several people sent back their food because it was salty! No go with salty and over priced meals! Anyway, BYPASS this Cesars not so royal restaurant! METHINKS NOT EVER AGAIN!!!

I really liked the meal I had here. I started off with the field greens and pear salad which was very good. The goat cheese was smeared across one side of plate then salad placed on side. I had never seen that before and it was sorta good but also made me think, what if they just didn't wash this plate? Lol
As main course had the beer braised short ribs with horseradish mashed potatoes. That was delicious, I had been on a no carb diet and eating those potatoes was like eating a rainbow for me. Very tasty. I didn't really get the 3 onion rings on top 1 would have been plenty but didn't think it really went with rest of dish. 
 For dessert had the milk and cookies which was amazing and couldn't finish them all so got some for breakfast snack. 
My server was great.

This place have mediocre food that is grossly over priced. There are much better options around the Vegas strip. The only plus for this restaurant was that there was no wait to get in while other places had 1-2 hour wait. Now i know why.

Food and service was very good. We ordered several shareables and had plenty of food for four people: Mac & Cheese was excellent and the chicken sliders were some of the best I've had. The biscuits - seriously amazing and not to be missed. I didn't love the duck fat fries, they didn't have as much flavor as I expected.

Wow. That's all I can say. I am a fairly picky eater and my friend was like, just try it. First off the homemade cheese puffs are on point. We had the peppers which were sweet and spicy at the same time. Then the pork butt came out. Name threw me off but was so good. The finale was the chocolate chip cookies. You will never have a better cookie in your life.

If I could give zero stars I would. We made reservations weeks in advance for dinner for a bachelor/bachelorette party for 12 people. Any smart restaurant manager would have that ready and waiting because it is an easy $1000 tab. We got there and waited for 25 minutes and the little snot hostess told us they are cleaning the table for 25 minutes. I asked what is going on that we had a reservation and they are not honoring it, she replied with extreme attitude. I have been several times to the Searsucker in San Diego and loved it so we were excited to celebrate and dine here with our friends. I will never return to eat at this location, as a restaurant manager myself I have never come across such an unprofessional establishment. Shame on you Las Vegas Searsucker.

Now added to the list of restaurants I'll return to in Vegas. I was on business; would consider it pricey otherwise. Knowledgeable professional server made the evening. Biscuits - yum. Peppers also very good. I had the Mexican shrimp with asparagus and was completely satisfied. Cozy atmosphere - a little noise, but not terrible for Vegas. Had a fun vibe with well done food.

This place is amazing! We went back 2 nights in a row! What brought us back was the strawberry jalapeño margarita (SO good) but we also tried several dishes. All were amazing. Ambience is modern with a fun twist.
Awesome experience. Everything we had was delicious. Our bartender Adrian was extremely friendly and insightful about the menu. I highly recommend the "infused" cocktails and the s'mores dessert.

I like the decor and vibe at this restaurant. The cocktails were pretty good. I went with the Skinny Jenny and then had a champagne cocktail. 

The hamachi appetizer is excellent. The beef tartar was also good. It could have used more quail egg. 

My boyfriend and I split the Tomahawk ribeye. I was so excited for this, but it was lackluster. Especially for an $85 steak. I found it to be tough and too fatty. And to the smart ass (Erik S) who called out that I should get a clue about a ribeye being fatty, I understand that the fat is what makes a ribeye delicious but when half the steak is fat I don't feel like I'm getting my money's worth. I've had plenty of ribeye steaks that are more meaty. My review, my opinion. 

My friend had the pork belly entree and said the flavors were good, but it was too rich to eat more than half of it. Pork belly is rich so you have to be in the mood for it. 

This place is worth a try, but I'm not running back.

Really wouldn't waste a trip here again. We waited at our table for about 8-10 minutes before even being greeted by our server. Then, when he did come, he just asked if we were ready; didn't ask if we wanted drinks or explain the menu at all. 

We ordered the mushrooms and burrata: it was good. The mushrooms were nicely seasoned but that's about it. We then ordered the shrimp and grits; nothing special. The food runner did great explaining the dishes though, so that was a plus. They then dropped off the lollipops (which we didn't order). I stated that we did not order them and the guy said that they were on the house. We weren't sure why. We tried 2 of them and weren't impressed so we just had them take them back. Our server then informed us that whomever dropped them at the table, made a mistake, so they really weren't "on the house" or compliments of anyone; it was just a mistake. 

Based on the two starters, we quickly decided not to waste the money on an entree. We ordered the ermagerd sundae and continued to wait for about 20-25 minutes before getting it. Really?! Being a pastry chef, it was obvious that everything in that dish was premade and just needed to be thrown together. The server came over after about 15 minutes to apologize and tell us that the person who makes the desserts also makes the salads and was in the weeds because of a large party. We got it about 10 minutes later. It was ice cream and two baby brownie bites and bananas; there's nothing bad you can really say about it.

The service really killed the experience. For two of us that work at a semi-fine dining restaurant in Chicago, we really expected more, but weren't that surprised. These places turn over thousands of guests, and it was apparent that they had that mentality. We wanted to spend a good penny here and order a bunch off the menu, but it all just started so poorly. Kinda a shame ..
The food was excellent food! Really tasty. Albacora with procciuto and quinoa were my favorits
I received a birthday offer from my work. The small plates were all amazing, the shishito peppers and shrimp scampi were amazing. I suggest this restaurant at my job as a great date night option!

Everything about this place says Cool. The vibe and decor is rustic yet modern. The long wooden tables make it feel homey yet trendy.

All of the food is fantastic- shishito peppers, biscuits, chicken, steak, shrimp.. 

Everyone was very happy with what they had!

As a southerner, searsucker represents classic southern charm and sophistication. This place was definitely shooting for that theme of country chic I guess you could say. They had decorated with pallet wall accents and some food was served in mason jars. The menu (especially apps) seemed to be twists on traditional southern favorites. We had the beef tartare and it was served in a mason jar with a wooden spoon. It came with crunchy toast and a small bowl of insanely good spicy pickles. The tartare hit the mark for sure. We got the pear and goat cheese salad which was also quite delicious. We ordered cocktails and wine during our meal and the service was definitely on point. We didn't wait for anything and our waitress checked in frequently. For the entree we got the swordfish grilled plain (there is an option for sauce that I skipped) and we got the shortrib. The shortrib was excellent although not the best I have ever had. But I can say the only place that ever beat it was a small farm to table restaurant in our hometown. The swordfish was lacking. Maybe I should have gone with a choice of sauce with it but I am a minimalist when it comes to food choosing to really taste the freshness and the quality of a meat over the accoutrements. It was a little over cooked but the side of Brussels was some of the best I've ever tasted. It came with an assortment of roasted peppers that were very tasty as well. We got the duck fat fries as a side for the shortrib and these are a must! 

The atmosphere is a mix of country meets Vegas and it comes off a little weird to me. The theme could have been pushed a little more to really drive it home but I understand this is a Caesars palace restaurant and the type of customer it caters to. I can say that the bathroom attendants were very pushy and overbearing but that has nothing really to do with the food. Overall...this is a great restaurant with some unique twists on dishes. I wouldn't say it's spectacular and we did have better food for the same price (around $200 for two people). But I am definitely not regretful we tried it....the beef tartare, pickles, duck fat fries and service made it worth the experience.

My wife and I tried this place last night and it was amazing! There's a tricky first step to get into the restaurant, so watch out for that. 

On to the food, I ordered the flank steak and my wife ordered the chicken. The food was absolutely delicious, one of the best meals I've ever eaten in Las Vegas. 

Our server did such a great job, took care of us and was on top of everything. Great vibe, food and service.

First time at Searsucker and it did not disappoint. Get the classic old fashioned, it is a great drink especially if prepared by Heather, a great bartender.  Get the burger and chipotle ketchup. Only 20 burgers are sold/made daily and it's worth every bite. Great place, great vibe, and great people there.

Dang good. Dannnnnnng good. Went with some buddies. All got different entres and all were top notch. Got beer braised short ribs. Beef was so tender i never picked up my knife. Did I say dang good? Lindsey was super on her game. Knew the menu, made the experience top notch.

Stopped in for a drink and a snack here on a Sunday evening.  I was thinking of going to the steak house, but the menu prices scared me away.  So I sat at the bar and had a drink and biscuits.

The drink - a "Smoked Old Fashioned" was really great.  Just fruity enough, a bit of campfire taste.  I also had a Long Island, which was adequate.

I ordered the appetizer biscuits, and I wasn't disappointed, but I was burned.  Literally - they arrived on a cast iron skillet and I burned my arm reaching over the skillet for my drink.  Didn't notice then, but the next day I had a blister on my arm, and it's still healing two weeks later.  But I contacted them (which wasn't easy, text messages or facebook page eventually found me the "security department" who relayed my message), and I was satisfied with their response; hopefully they will cover the handles in the future.  Because the biscuits were really, really tasty.

The only other strikes were the staff grumbling to each other about how hard it is to find a good job in Vegas, and the lingering stench of 50-some years of cigarettes and sorrow in the carpets outside in the casino I had to walk through to get there.

Great food, excellent service, yummy drinks and a bargain happy hour - what more could you want? 

The first time we went we missed happy hour, but went anyway because we were hungry. We had the short ribs (to die for!), mushrooms on toast and drinks. The waiter very sweetly brought us a dessert on the house because of missing happy hour - it was delightful, as thoughtful things always are!

Went back the next night for happy hour, and tried to eat them out of house and home. Duck fat fries were outstanding, more short ribs, cheese puffs, a couple of salads, shrimp and grits - everything was on point and delicious, plus bargain priced. Don't miss it!

Amazing in every way. We came around 5:15pm and walked into their Happy Hour (5-7p) and fell in love with the place. We ordered the shishito peppers, Bone Marrow, Tomahawk Steak with roasted mushrooms with herbs and the Walnut Brussel Sprouts. Definitely sit at the bar, it starts to get busy around 6p. Amazing food, awesome drinks and SPECTACULAR SERVICE!!!
Searsucker never disappoints. The filet I had was amoung the best I've had. The staff was friendly and the service outstanding.
I had dinner and the food was great. Highly recommend this place if you're in Vegas. it's not outrageously priced and a good atmosphere.

After unwelcoming reception at Old Homestead, we opted to sit at the bar at Searsucker.

Living in San Diego for the last 20 years, am well acquainted with Brian Malarkey's hospitality style and it mates up VERY nicely with the Las Vegas "thang".

The entire joint was jumpin' at 6:45 pm(Happy Hour daily 5:00-7:00 pm) on 1/21/17, Heather was our mixologist/server and we were instantly happy and relaxed.

I picked the "Blueberry Ginger Smash"-Old Forester / ginger / honey / blueberry / mint($8.00)...it was tremendous, packed a punch and had great flavor.  My friend had the Ballast Point beer, can't remember which flavor or how much it cost.  For eats, we had the Sliders($9.00 for two/order two, you'll want it!)-chipotle / cheddar / bacon....like a chipotle aoli topping, the beef was a nice size, two/three bites, juicy and flavorful....very, very nice, will be watching in the future to see if that stays on the menu.  We also got the tuna tacos ($9.00 for three) which were equally dilish!-blackend ahi / avocado/ jalapeno relish.  Deep fried shell, very thin and perfectly seasoned....highly recommended.

A word about Heather.....funny, smart and on her game, she will be sure to go far by reading the signs a customer is giving and paying attention to the small details.  Awesome person and Searsucker is lucky to have her!

Any Yelper in the vicinity of Caesar's should check this joint out and have a great time.  My experience was virtually without any fault, get to it!

Ambiance/Cleanliness-no bs here, it was good to go from the moment we sat down!...5 stars

Service- very nice, no major problems......4 stars

Food-see above for a food review, it was very good, but not in that rarified five star experience....a well deserved....4 stars!

What a bummer. Took some friends back after a fantastic first-time experience at Searsucker and ended up with some major disappointments. 

What was still good: Most of the food, ambiance, drinks.

What I learned this time that I didn't know last time: Happy Hour pricing is a gimmick and only available at the bar.

What slipped this time:
- The duck fat fries - for lack of a more eloquent way to put it - sucked. It was my FAVORITE dish and I was so eager to order it again. I was the uber hype woman for this dish. Imagine my disappointment and frankly embarrassment when my friends tried it along with me and found it to taste exactly like normal fries. No more savory/umami flavors. I asked the waitress what's up. She said they switched over to fresh not frozen fries recently. I'm not a food chemist so I can't say if that affected the taste of what but it was night and day. I would not order this again.
- The buffalo wings are midget (ahem, I mean 'size challenged'). Super duper tiny.
- Service. Our waitress was present, but sometimes we had to wait awhile for her to come around, otherwise we didn't see her at all. May not be her fault in a busy part of the restaurant. She was also brusque and a little sarcastic, which I didn't anticipate given the warm service we received the first time by someone else.
- Website says you can get complimentary entry to Omnia. We asked about it on the way out. Turns out you need to buy a certain amount of food for each complimentary entrance, which is reasonable. What bemused me was that it took them about 10 minutes to sign off this perk for us. Required a manager's approval so we had to wait.

Don't know what happened this time, but the allure definitely faded. If this was my first experience at Searsucker, I would not have returned.
Pretty good place on the strip. Drinks are awesome and happy hour specials are perfect. Give it a try if you're nearby.
3 things to recommend off the menu: the bone marrow, scallops, and the rocky road bread pudding

I had one of the best meals of my life at Searsucker on this trip to Vegas. The atmosphere is amazing, the servers were awesome, and amazing at accommodating my gluten allergy! Can't recommend this place highly enough. Holy wow the meal was seriously so good - if/when i go back, I don't even know what I'll order because everything was so amazing!! Our favorite dishes of the night: 

Drinks:
- Strawberry Jalapeno (if you like spicy margaritas, get this!!)
- Fizzy Lifter

Dinner:
- Short rib with horseradish potatoes
- Roasted cauliflower with pickled chilis, pine nuts, citrus
- Heirloom roasted carrots with thai pesto and crushed peanuts
- Scallops over kabocha squash puree, caramelized mushrooms, butternut squash and bacon bits - 36
- Salmon with white bean ragout and herbs - 29

Also. For dessert, we had the daily scoop - mango sorbet and salted caramel ice cream (or gelato)? AMAZING.

Wow, where to begin...

I was lucky enough to go to Searsucker with a large party of people. I say "lucky" because this allowed me to try a lot of different menu items. 

First things first, though the seating and the vibe are perfect for large parties, the restaurant is extremely loud. Also, we were seated at a long, rectangular table, so in order to speak to someone across the way, you either had to shout or temporarily move seats. This made for a difficult dining experience conversation-wise.

However, I have relatively no complaints about the food. Though I would like to mention that I was tricked into eating a Rocky Mountain Oyster (bleh, yuck). For all of you sweet, innocent souls out there (like myself) that have no idea what Rocky Mountain Oysters are, please read the following statement; they are testicles. That's right. If the idea of eating such a thing makes you squeamish, then do not order the Cowboy Caviar. I honestly cannot attest to the taste, as my opinion is now completely jaded by the fact that I had never, ever wanted to eat bull testicles in my life. Ever. 

Moving on; I personally ordered the Duck Fat Fries with Chipotle Ketchup. This was, of course, delicious because...well, because it's fries all done up fancy and such. I also enjoyed the smoky ketchup, and I'm not necessarily a fan of chipotle in the first place. Along with the fries, I ordered the Tomato Soup with Toast and Cheese (AKA, grilled cheese). Yum, yum, yum was it good. The soup is drizzled with some sort of pesto sauce on top. The grilled cheese is greasy, melty, and super-cheesy in all of the ways that matter. Finally, I also ordered the "Spicy" Shrimp Bacon Grits. And I died...from deliciousness. Wow. For all of you that are wary of spicy foods, I would say the spiciness level is "medium". It's slightly hotter than mild, but not too hot. In the picture I've supplied, it looks very different from how you'd expect grits to look but rest assured, they're there - under all that shrimp and sauce and delicious flavor. 

As a party, we also ordered the Hamachi Tostadas, the Artichoke Hearts with Cheddar and Mozzarella, the Brussels Sprouts and the Scallops (entree). Of all of those, I particularly enjoyed the artichoke dip the best. It comes with cheesy toast, as you can see in the picture. 

All in all, eating at Searsucker was quite the experience. I only wish I had heard about it when I was still living in San Diego, as they also have a location there. Hopefully Reno will get one eventually as well! It's definitely a must-try.

Happy feasting!

Was here with a group of 8 people in which we decided to do family style dining and order several different things and just share. I'm sad to say the best thing I had that night was their Duck Fat Fries and the Cheddar Puffers. The item I was most looking forward to was the Tomahawk Ribeye but it was over-salted, which seemed to be a theme for them that night. I also tried the Duck which was nothing special and the Mahi which was tough and flavorless. 

Honestly the only reason they got two stars was that their cocktails were very well done and the half priced bottles of wine for locals. 

Overall I'm not in any hurry to return or recommend this place to anyone.

My first time at this place was amazing. Service was awesome. I was so excited to come back to Vegas to eat at Searsucker. It was such a disappointment. We went during happy hour on Wednesday. We sat and waited for a server. We ended up going to the bar for menus where the bartender said our server would be with us shortly. After waiting 15 minutes we ended up ordering at the bar. The place wasn't busy. In fact, I saw a couple employees standing at the bar. When our food came out it was delivered by someone who worked in the kitchen, we had to ask him for silverware and plates. Nobody ever checked in on us and we ended up going to the bar again to ask for our check. This place was one of my favorite stops when I visited and has become the only bad experience on my vacation. :(

My boss recommended this place to me because he had heard great reviews from the one in SD. Decided to have my birthday dinner here and overall the food was remarkable. The mussels with chorizo were amazing, the chorizo bits were so tasty gave the whole dish an amazing taste. The squid sweet heat was probably the best squid I have had and this tends to be a dish I order at every restaurant and is by far the best tasting here at Searsucker. All of the appetizers came in large sizes. We also got the duck fat fries with chipotle ketchup towards the end, and OMG, loved them! I'm not a duck fan but you really couldn't taste duck. I got the mahi baja dish the meat was so tender and those almonds and drunken cherries just blended in very well in every bite. My boyfriend got the hanger butcher steak and he thought it was okay. The only disappointing thing and the reason why I didn't give five stars is because the entree is literally just the piece of meat, the dishes don't come with anything else like a side. Good thing we had ordered the duck fat fries along with the entrees. Their cocktail ballerina and the czar was good. To end the dinner our awesome waitress recommended the s'mores bar for dessert, so glad she did! Not one crumb was left of that. Oh, not to mention the service was great our waiter was so friendly and kept checking up on us to make sure our experience was going great, she even started a conversation with us and mentioned how she loved locals coming into Searsucker.

Super friendly staff (super attentive) food was on point. I've never felt more welcomed at a restaurant before. I would highly recommend the strawberry jalapeño margaritas so D'lish!!! Definitely coming back with all my friends and family again .

Let me start by saying we should have known things would not be outstanding based on the crowd. It was completely dead!!!!! We stopped in for quick appetizers and drinks before omnia. Drinks were delicious and decently priced. Food, not so good! Jars on the menu is quite literal... The food comes in s jar. We ordered about 6 appetizers for 5 girls and that was enough. I absolutely loved the crab and avocado but that's about it. Beef tartare came up short, as did the tuna tartare and honestly the rest of the food was so mediocre I can't even remember what else we ordered. The scene is cute and it's a great location but not really up to par with the competition.

Walk. Don't walk. That's the sign at the entrance. Much like a pedestrian crossing light. This place must be fun! The hostesses were welcoming and promptly offered an invite into the restaurant. Once my friend arrived we were shown inside by the lovely Stephanie who showed us the bar and the kitchen area, as well as our "people watching seats". It's nice to see the kitchen operation in action. Everything the chefs were working on looked fresh.  Desiree was our server. She came to us right away to welcome us and brought the Happy Hour menus. We had about 15 minutes before their Happy Hour was over so we promptly ordered four cocktails and 2 appetizers. The cocktails were crafty and delicious. The fuck dat fries, sorry the Duck Fat Fries with chipotle ketchup had just the right combination of flavors, they were pulpy, fresh and crispy, not too spicy (thank goodness for me!). I couldn't taste the duck but they were delish nonetheless . The short rib "the harlot" though was soooo freaking good! It was tender and juicy and the mashed potatoes and the crispy onions OMG I could eat like 3 or 4 or 5 of those orders! Yumm! We followed with the strawberry walnut goat cheese salad, Wow great combination of textures, with fruit and crunchiness and fresh greens. Then the Tuna albacore wrapped in prosciutto, sherry alioli and balsamic balls (gooey balls, yumm!) with a delicious Frisée salad, barely seared but definitely rear tuna (sashimi grade for sure!) was sooooooo good! The tuna just melts in your mouth! By then I was starting to feel full but I couldn't stop eating it. Unfortunately we had no room for dessert but the chocolate chip cookies looked finger licking good. Desiree was super friendly and informative and kept us entertained in between dishes. She made some excellent recommendations. You could tell she enjoys talking about the different menu items and how much she loved trying them all during pre-opening. If you are lucky enough to get Desiree during your visit, you will be a pampered guest! Her assistant Ahi (Aji?) (I called him Ajilipollas) was friendly and always kept our water glasses topped. I can't wait to visit Searsucker again so I can try the other items I wish I could've eaten today. I'm no terminator but "I'll be back!".

Check it out between 5pm - 7pm for happy hour, they have some great deals and the food was fabulous. I would recommend their duck fat french fries and hummus. The bread that they serve with the hummus was fantastic, it was warmed and oiled lightly. The hummus had roasted chickpeas mixed in, grilled lemon, and was spot on. The potions were good sized and we ended up having enough that we didn't need any dinner later. The cocktails can get very pricy here (15++) but again they had some great craft cocktails for $9 during happy hour so split some appetizers and take advantage of the deals. Love this place!

Food here was really good, but super pricy. I really liked the tuna tare tar the best. It was so flavorful and tasted perfect with the crispy potato chips. We got free pickles with a check in with yelp. It was good, but super salty, so you have to eat it was other things in your meal the balance out the saltiness. The portions were small, so we had to order a lot of food and it was so pricy. 
I felt like our server was awkward and forcing us to order things off the menu that we didn't really want. I probably would try other places when I am in Vegas again.
Braised short rib, eggs & bacon, calamari, quinoa, and other things. I ate a month ago so I forgot. I just remember the food was legit. The service was impeccable.

I decided to dine here before seeing Celine Dion (which was canceled that day because she got sick). The menu looked pretty enticing online and I was eager to try a few dishes. 

Unfortunately, I wasn't impressed. I felt the food was mediocre and overpriced. 

I went with small plates so I could sample different things:

Pig ears - I was so excited to see pig ears on the menu. Growing up in Taiwan, pig ears is a common dish where they marinade with Chinese five spice and make it crunchy but not rubbery. I haven't had pig ears for couple of decades so I was looking forward to this dish. Unfortunately, it wasn't what I expected. The ears were chewy/rubbery and way too salty. I guess if you are drinking beer, this would be good beer bar food. It's not very good on its own. 

Calamari steak with chili honey glaze - The server recommended it to me. While the portion is decent and the meat cooked right, the flavor isn't impressive. Maybe it's because I grew up in Taiwan so I'm so used to the sauces that it's nothing new to me. They basically flash fried the calamari steak and the tossed them in some Chinese spicy and sweet sauce that you can buy at 99 Ranch store and call it the day. 

Duck fat fries - Tasted just like regular fries. Nothing special. 

I was quite disappointed with this experience. If you aren't used to Asian flavors, you might enjoy this place. Otherwise, skip it.

Excellent place to meet up with friends.  I really loved their scallops and chicken entree. The steak was ok.  They make excellent cocktails and I highly recommend going for their happy hour.  Price point is about average..just like anywhere else on the strip.

I was traveling for work and some of my coworkers wanted to find some place nearby for happy hour. They had some really good looking dishes on happy hour but the really selling point was the price! Drinks $5-8 and apps for $9 is pretty much unheard of in Las Vegas, especially on the strip. We each got a drink, nothing special. For apps my favorite was the duck fat prosciutto dusted fries. They were perfectly crispy, probably twice fried. We also got the tomato burrata which was delicious but didn't really fit the theme of the other food. We also got there sliders (opted for lettuce wrapped) and the seasoning of the meat was very good. There was cheddar and bacon mixed into the meat itself which you could tell it really enhanced the flavor. My coworker got the tuna tacos, which were in wonton wrappers. There was a pretty large about of tuna but she said they weren't seasoned very well. All around, I would go back for happy hour by stick to the sliders and fries.

We stopped in here on a recent trip to Vegas for a quick happy hour tide-over before our late dinner reservations. We went right when they were supposed to open at 5, and we were basically told they weren't ready to open. So we waited for a bit until they were. Then we were seated in the bar area. It took quite some time for a server to approach us, and when she did, she wasn't exactly bursting with excitement about her job. I ordered the sliders and partner ordered some sort of taco thing. Both were okay, but nothing we would have raved about given the other high end options we visited while we were in town. As others have mentioned, it's dark and loud, so while it was fine when we first got there, but about 6 p.m. it was crowded and overbearing. In all, I probably would have gone with 3 on the food and drink alone (and the happy hour deals were nice), but the service was poor enough that I took it down one star.

I love the searsucker in San Diego so my friends and I just had to check out the Las Vegas one. It's pretty different but the experience/ambiance was just as good. I like how the lighting was dim. We sat at the bar for happy hour and each got a specialty cocktail that was so so...but once we started talking to the bartenders they steered us in the right direction. I would recommend changing the cocktail list on happy hour because the couple sitting next to us weren't very impressed either. We had so much fun with the two bartenders. Phill(?) and the blonde girl were so funny! it started our night off right. The girl told us about the wings, peppers and that tomato bruschetta type dish was a must have and she was right. So yummy! She explained how the wings and peppers were prepared because personally, I've never heard of them before and I'm glad I tried something new.

Located in ceasars. We had made ressies and were promptly seated. Ambiance is beautiful - lots of wood and ropes channeling a very natural and warm space. I got a drink that was lychee and sake based and it was just ok. Normally those are my favorite type of drinks. We got the tuna poke as a starter and that was 5 stars!!!! The tuna was deliciously seasoned and loaded on a very delicate crisp seaweed chip. I could've eaten 10 more of those. For dinner we settled on the 2 lb lobster meal for two along with potatoes and Brussel sprouts. The lobster came out quickly and was perfectly grilled with a side of butter of course. My only complain is this meal will likely leave most people hungry. Most of the meat is in the tail which wasn't much and there's some in the claw. Thank god it came with sides. Both Brussel sprouts and mashed potatoes were good. For dessert we tried the bread pudding which came loaded with lit s'mores. Cool concept but the timing is pretty important here and the s'mores were very burned by the time the dish arrived at our table. It looked pretty carcinogenic so we didn't really touch it and the bread pudding was just ok. The dessert menu was pretty limited and the other 3 options were all cold. Would've liked to see a chocolate cake or something. Overall great experience. Apps and entrees seem solid. Cocktails and dessert are more of a hit or miss.

The food was good, my party of 4 had 3 really good dishes. My dish, a chicken with a poached egg was okay.  It was missing something like a thicker sauce ( perhaps a simple wine, cream and morel sauce). However; my hubby's Mahi Mani was Delish! Right amount of sauce, some type of fruit or currant(I don't recall) but great! The Pork Butt, OMG,so good and cooked perfectly. It was a whole meal, there were a few pieces of greens on the plate. My daughter, a 14 year old princess had the $40.00 filet, and she would not give me any! She is a steak conisure and she orders medium and she said it was cooked perfectly. I think she has a picture I will upload. The only downside,it was a lacarte, we didn't eat the sides much, the water at $9, was overpriced so we spent way too much. I think the prices are a little steep but if you hVe the money...go and enjoy!

I almost forgot...the service is great! The Server was really knowledgeble and they are quick to refill and take dirty plates away. Service was top notch!

We had all shared plates. Delicious food made uniquely; octopus, calamari, chicken wings. Service was very helpful and took care of us without interruption. Not the best view nor atmosphere but once the food came it didn't matter. They were also quick to get out the first plates. I would go back again to try other plates and enjoy again some of the previous ones.

Great customer service!  The calimari was not that great smothered in sweet sauce. And fries too much seasoning. The burger was good but not great. Their house wine sweet ;/ but great ambiance and staff. And convenient if in Caesars.

Went here for my birthday dinner, just the boyfriend and I. We shared two tapa like plates (short ribs and spicy shrimp with grits) both very delicious especially the shrimp and grits and we also shared a main plate (tuna wrapped in prosciutto) this was ok kind of bland tasting. The service was excellent and they brought out our ordered dessert with a candle and sang happy birthday to me...the cocktail I also got was delicious, definitely had a kick... jalaberry strawpeno!

Went there the other night without knowing much about it. It was a lot better than I expected. The food and service was very good and even the decor was pleasantly nice. The calamari was delicious for an appetizer but if you want my advice, if you go, make sure you get the braised pork. You'll thank me later. It was done to complete perfection.

My friends and I bought tickets to attend the #VegasStrong benefit show at Omnia, and Oliver at the Hakkasan concierge group reached out to me with a dinner deal at Searsucker. $55 a person for either the prix fixe menu, or spend $55 on the a la carte menu. The entrees are around $30ish, so if you get a cocktail and an appetizer or dessert you're pretty much set. The bonus was a bottle of wine for each four people, and expedited entry into Omnia, which is a huge plus because the lines can get pretty crazy.

I don't remember our server's name, but he handled our party of 12 really well. We opted to do family style sharing plates, so he basically just ordered the menu highlights for us and made it work out to $55 a person. I think we probably would've gotten more food if we would have ordered on our own, but I'm much more of a tapas girl so small portions and bigger variety are right up my alley. They were super nice and even brought out different plates for my gluten-intolerant friend. I lost count, but we probably had about a dozen dishes in all. 

Highlights were the burrata, scallops and the skirt steak. The beer marinade on the drunken skirt steak is amazing. The calamari was also really good - strip cut instead of rings and tentacles - super tender, with a yummy chili honey glaze. I'm a huge fan of short ribs and had high expectations for theirs, but it wasn't as "fall apart" as some other ones I've had. We also had hummus, poke, wings, heirloom carrots, brussels, and the brick chicken - everything was good, just nothing super special. I also had a smoked old fashioned, which was really well done. I wish I would have stirred it first though, because I had a sip that was all smoked maple syrup and almost dropped my glass. But once everything was mixed together the flavors were amazing! We skipped dessert because we had to head into Omnia for the show, but I could've easily put down an ice cream sandwich. 

Ambiance wise, the restaurant was packed, not a ton of room between tables. EDM music is blasting; I assume because of their partnership with Omnia. Luckily for me that's right up my alley, but it's loud enough that I couldn't hear my friend two seats away. If you're going for dinner and convo, this probably isn't the place for you. But overall, I think it's a decently priced place on the strip with good food, and a great place to grab drinks and small bites before a night out.

I popped in here because the hubs was playing Texas Hold 'Em.  I sat at the bar, ordered a glass of wine, did my Yelp check in, and poof, up pops an offer for a complimentary habanero and coriander pickle.  Never to turn something spicy down, I asked for it.  Well, shut it...that damn pickle rocked my world.  Spicy brine, nice heat, and um, hello, it's a pickle.  What is not to love about pickles?  Nice wines BTG.  Cool menu, creative flavors.

This place was so good. We came in on a Sunday and they had football playing on the TVs. Their menu was small and appeared to have only football snack foods. We ordered anyway. We ordered the buffalo wings and fried chicken and eggs. The food was sooooooo good. All of it. I think my fiancé got the biscuits, also delicious. 

The only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because they were training the bar back to make drinks. Well, they said they were training him but every time he got a ticket for drinks he would let it sit there and wait until a waiter or a bartender would come by for them to make it. (I know this because I sat in view of the bar). 

Waited too long for our drinks. When you're in Vegas that's the last thing you want. Disappointed in the training and in the barback.

I was waiting for my parents while they were gambling in the casino. I sat at the bar and tried to get the attention and service from a tall woman/young lady bartender. She had a Raiders t-shirt on so I asked her if she was from the Bay Area or if she was a fan. She replied with a no, then mentioned to me that she was from LA, then walked away. I had to wait for another employee to ask me if I would like to place an order for food and drink. I was treated and welcomed nicely by a gentleman bartender and sat by very friendly patrons. If management is reading this, I would offer her your love until  she learns to love herself. I will pray for her. God Bless.

came here for a private cocktail event. great atmosphere. It is right next to Omnia so it was the perfect place to go before hitting the club. the cocktail was amazing and the hors d'oeuvres were great. tried its crab-cake, sliders, lollipop wings, and tomato & burrata. I find the lollipop wings to be on the salty side but everything else was great! slider is extremely delicious. i would definitely come back again.

Oh my goodness. It isn't often that I feel compelled to write a 5-star review, but this place demands it. Hubby and I had the most wonderful meal here. First of all our server, Charles, was hilarious and engaging. This place labels itself as "a social dining experience" (hey, it's on the receipt like that) and I think they mean because from the moment you walk in, they try to get to know you. The hostess asked us a few questions, and clearly passed that onto our server before he came over to our table, because he was prepped with the info. He started off with a little joke of singing something, which my husband and I quickly joined in on, so we immediately started off on the right foot. Dinner consisted of all small plates. We got the duck fat fries, mushroom burrata toast, egg & pork belly, and short ribs. The fries are tied for first place as the best fries I've ever had. They were perfectly light and crispy, without being dry. The mushroom & burrata toast was incredible with such flavorful, rich mushrooms. The pork belly is essentially grown up eggs Benedict on broiche toast with Hollandaise. It was good, but sadly not warm when we finally got around to eating it (we ordered too much food!) and the short rib, while tender, was not terribly exciting in the flavor department (think pot roast) but still well cooked and falling-apart tender. After seeing a bunch of desserts pass by the table, hubby and I had some room left in our tummies from just sticking to small plates, so we ordered three, yes three, desserts. The desserts are awesome here. The apple crostata was a lovely rustic pie crust purse filled with caramelized apples. After the warm apples, we went the other direction and got something cold with the Ermagerd Sundae. The peanut butter gelato in this sundae is heavenly. It had such rich peanut butter flavor without being too heavy or losing it's creaminess. We had them bring one dessert at a time so we could digest enough to press on. After all this, we still had another dessert on the way. The finale was the S'more bar. The honey flavor in the graham cracker crust was very robust and I had tasted that wonderful honey in a couple of other dishes. I would love to know what kind of honey they use, it's a good one. The chocolate on top of the crust is a very heavy bodied, rich chocolate mousse, topped with whipped marshmallow topping that is torched. It was all delicious. Our server was great throughout the whole meal and we enjoyed him a lot. The meal was excellent all around and I will definitely come back here each time I go to Vegas. Do not miss the desserts here.
Pretty good. Becareful, they will try very hard to upsell you big time, esp with water!

We came here on a Saturday night after we learned about the Omnia Nightclub deal. Basically, each person in your party must spend $50 and you will receive a "chip" that will allow you complimentary expedite meaning, you do not have to wait in line. Now you definitely need to pay to get inside the club, so this chip only lets you come in front of the line. Try and get on a guestlist by looking up on IG etc, then you may get lucky and receive complimentary entry as well. (We wanted to go see Zedd, so we used this chip and got on a guest list that gave us free admission until 1am; arrived around 11:45 and the club was already packed!!!!)

Anyhow, for the food, we had the tuna tacos and octopus for appetizer. Honestly, I expected more but it was very mediocre, not especially tasty or flavorful. For our entrée, we ordered the lobster which was AMAZING. The lobster came with mashed potatoes and brussel sprouts that paired well with the lobster.

Would I recommend this restaurant? Probably not, but if you are trying to get into Omnia yes, I think it is a great deal.

We tried Searsucker fourth of July weekend and really honestly wanted to like it. We did our research and we were excited to try several of the menu items. We were "greeted" by the two completely unenthusiastic hostesses and taken to our table. Our server Tammie was knowledgeable when it came to menu and drink suggestions. My husband wasn't thrilled with his unbalanced rather sweet "signature" old fashioned. But being in Vegas we were both still looking forward to enjoying our dinner.  

We were seated in the open kitchen area, which we love! and were shocked to watch the chef touch every raw garnish of every plate of food and then wipe his hands on his apron-less pants, face and phone. Not appetizing in the least. We then watched the manager (at least that's who think was the manager) touch every bit of face, eyes, nose, lips and then proceeded to touch the raw garnish on a dish before sending it along with a food runner. Obviously once we saw a few of these incidents we began to notice even more of them. Kind of like a train wreck- you just can't look away! 

My husband and I both work in the industry and are sensitive to some of these issues.  We are never THAT table (unhappy without merit or reason) but we found ourselves being irritated with the compounding service issues. Everyone was on their phones almost the entire time! And I don't say/write this lightly.  The chef, the "manager" and a woman who we assumed was an assistant manager were on their phones for significant periods of time, constantly texting. I get it, we all have lives and communicate constantly but step off of the floor and send your quick text but to stand out openly in the dining room for 5 plus minutes on your phone makes no sense and is unacceptable. 
The "assistant manager", a younger woman, did not put her phone down once, seriously not once the entire evening. We were laughing about it by the end of the night, that's something that we have never seen before.

Neither the food nor the signature cocktails were a saving grace unfortunately.  We tried a few appetizers wanting to get a good idea of the concept and the Chef.  We started with a couple of the "jar" dishes, the first was the crab, very one note.  The crab was hammered by Sriracha mayo and gargantuan pieces of Avocado.  Next the tomato and burrata jar, was perhaps the "best" appetizer we had, but the burrata itself was begging and pleading for salt, which is not offered on the tables, lol! 

We also ordered the bone marrow and pork belly both of which were incredibly sweet.  We didn't even touch the third bone because the sweetness was overwhelming which honestly is saying something because we are both huge marrow fans.  The only thing we remember about the pork belly was how sweet it was.  

Lastly we ordered a grass fed NY steak with two sides.  We ordered the strip medium rare, it came out BLUE, completely cold in the middle.  As we took 5 minutes contemplating sending the steak back we realized we were also missing one of our sides.  

We NEVER send things back to the kitchen but were at this point rather frustrated and wanted to at least finish our meal and get out of there. The steak was returned to us warmed through a healthy rare but at least edible.  When the corn finally arrived it was by far the best thing we ate that night.  It had a nice balance of smoky, spicy and creamy. The cauliflower was good at first but quickly became rather one vinegary note. 

As a last note, while the manager and Chef were steps away from us the entire 2 plus hours we were having dinner, neither of them bothered to acknowledge, greet, check-in, chat, smile, or honestly look at us.  Why even have an open kitchen if you aren't invested in engaging the dining room???? 

This was the LEAST expensive dinner we ate on our trip and the MOST disappointing by far. IMO service was awful, food was mediocre. 
All in all we left feeling frustrated that we wasted an evening of our trip at Searsucker, what a bummer!

The ambiance and food is good. We ordered many of their small plates to share: calamari steaks, octopus, hamachi, duck fat fries, brussels, cauliflower and bone marrow. Everything was OK, there was nothing I ate that I would say was exceptional. However, everything did "look" pretty tasty and while it did taste good, again, nothing special.

We ordered the grilled cheese, a couple salads, the tuna tacos and some sliders. I would say the grilled cheese was the best of all these selections. Nice presentation and really tasty as well.

My one gripe about our experience was our waitress, she seems so over it before our wine even came out. It was a bummer because I truly believe the experience is a huge part of eating out (at least for me). She was dry and emotionless and seemed annoyed overall, which put a damper on our experience, unfortunately. Also, the place was pretty empty, which was weird for a Saturday night in Vegas at 9 pm. 

I think I prefer Herringbone Las Vegas...but probably wouldn't turn down coming here again, the food was decent enough to try again.

One of my favorite experiences. A friend invited me and I got there late and everything was almost completely devoured. What was left and that I was able to eat was incredible.  Woooow. Will visit again.

It was our first time here and it was more amazing than we what we heard. Servers were upbeat and wonderful. Desiree was awesome and had great knowledge of the menu. Definitely coming back for more. Ermahgurd!!

This place is located right next door to Omnia. We came here for dinner with plans to go to the nightclub afterwards. The food was surprisingly delicious! We ordered a bunch of different items to share amongst our group, and a whole lot of cocktails to get the party started early. I tried my friend's "Fizzy Lifter" cocktail and it was light, fruity and yummy! I would recommend that for any girls who like fruity drinks. My favorite item out of everything we ordered was the spicy hamachi and avocado! I don't usually do spicy food, but this dish was very tolerable. The guys also got the 36 oz ribeye tomahawk. Let me tell you--that thing is massive!!! They couldn't even finish it. Overall it was a wonderful dining experience.
Happy Hour Review - Skip the humous, order the sliders, duck fat fries or bruschetta.  Don't order the martini with the honey and blue, way too sweet.

Amazing drinks, delicious food and a great atmosphere is the perfect combination for a relaxing and enjoyable dining experience.  We tried this place because we liked the menu online and live in SoCal and with the options near home it was a good way to try some yummy food that we may also be able to try when home.  We will be trying the restaurants near home for sure too.  

The service was solid but we also were there during Happy Hour so it was a slight slow at times but over all very solid.

We went during Happy Hour and got a collection to share at the table to try several different options.

Hummus - very flavorful and the bread was delicious alone but the hummus added to
It.

Potato fries - anything fried in duck fat is going to be amazing and this did not disappoint.  The prosciutto dust added to the flavor.

Slider - perfectly cooked and had a nice spicy to them.

Tuna taco - fresh and flavorful

Cocktails and food were delicious, great atmosphere.  I would give it a 5 but my steak came out well done instead of medium rare the first time but they corrected it with grace.  Definitely will come back.
Stopped by for happy hour before a show.  Nice atmosphere and decor.  Hummus was excellent and the pita bread was housemade.  Tuna tacos were also very good.

Just okay. Service was pretty annoying. Either they wouldn't leave us alone so we could finish certain items, or we had to ask for every little thing. They bugged us constantly as we ate, then literally disappeared for 15 minutes after we finished. I cannot stand bad service when I'm paying at a high price point. 

Best part - Short ribs with horse radish mash. So so good. Worst part - over cooked New York that the waiter held in 'better light' over my friend's head to show us that it was 'what we ordered.' So unprofessional and quite rude. My husband is much more forgiving and just ate it since the waiter argued with us about the degree of cooking. We were sharing so I actually didn't eat any steak. Thankfully my friends shared the short rib with me. 

Pear goat cheese salad was good. Kale Ceasar was good. Mac and cheese was good. Butter potatoes were good. All was just good. Vegas, Ceasars Palace, Saturday nights....I want great for the amount of money we are paying. 

I won't be back. Not with 100 other options in a 1 mile radius.

Being the good wife that I am, I took my husband out for dinner at Searsucker.  Having dined here before I knew he would enjoy their tasty dishes.  

I originally just wanted to stop in for happy hour but since they had an event going on in the bar area, we stepped in for a full dining experience.  Service was great! Before we met our waiter, another waiter stopped over for drink orders.  He noticed ours was busy with another table and didn't want us to go unnoticed.  Very thoughtful and attentive! During the rest of our meal service was nothing less than excellent.  He was professional and courteous. 

We started with the lollipop buffalo wings with the blue cheese fondue.  Well it isn't really fondue so much as it is just a small cup blue cheese dressing.  But the wings are good.  The meat came right off the bone so easily.  Tasty starter for sure.  

The delicious meals we ordered were wonderful! I enjoyed the beer braised short ribs served over horseradish potatoes topped with two onion rings.  So tender, flavorful and mouthwatering.  I should have stopped at eating half but it was just too good to stop.  

My husband ordered the filet medium rare as usual.  His belief is that a steak should not need any sauce to be good.  Well they nailed it here.  The perfectly cooked steak was before him.  There wasn't any doubt it was good since he cleaned the plate.  

Chef Malarkey has done a fine job with Searsucker.  I'm looking forward to my next visit!

We were on the Strip at Caesars for a show and wanted to grab a light dinner afterwards. Seersucker had decent yelp reviews and was very close to the theater so we thought we would give it a try. Almost immediately after we sat down, Tyler, Our server came by to greet us, get our drink orders, and explain the menu. Immediately made us feel very welcome. Because we were not terribly hungry we decided we would go for three small plates and their corn bread muffins. For the small plates we got the calamari, the octopus, and the short ribs. Tyler told us that the calamari is one of their house specialties. He did not lie. They were quite good. The octopus is grilled. It was tasty. But nothing really special. The short ribs with mashed potatoes were short ribs with mashed potatoes, also nothing really special. The cornbread muffins with the specialty butter actually the highlight of the evening. Quite tasty for only five dollars, If you consider a restaurant charging for 7 really small muffins to be OK.
So if the calamari was quite good, and the cornbread muffins were also good, and the service was excellent, why only three stars. You have to take into account value. Each of the small plates dishes were $18. I thought this was a little on the high side even for the strip. In addition, they nail you put $12 in parking.So when you figure 3 small shared plates, no adult beverages, and parking plus tax and tip was $90. Not a great value. Definitely would not go back here and would not recommend

This place is very lively for happy hour, I recommend stopping by and grabbing a table at the bar. Our happy hour menu did not look like the ones that people posted on here so they may have updated it or they have different menus different nights.

We ordered a bunch of cocktails but really loved the matador and skinny jenny. We also loved the pork chips, fish tacos and sliders. I could have eaten 3 orders of the pork chips, they were wonderful. 

The only things we didn't love were the chicken wings and the shishito peppers, they were both fine just not what we were expecting.

We came here for happy hour, the drinks were priced ok for Vegas $5-9.  The food was good, I guess we expected more from a top chef restaurant.  The biggest issue that we had was we had asked for the avocado on the side of our ahi tuna tacos because I am allergic to avocado but my wife isn't.  The bartender that took our order explained it was already on the side.  After my first bite into the taco I realized it was on the bottom of the taco as well.  Very disappointing.
We also order the lollipop wings which were $9 on happy hour.  They had good flavor, but I don't think they were anything special.

Date - June 15, 2015

After have a decent, but not great, dinner at Hakassan we cabbed back to Caesars (our home base) for dessert at Searsucker. The place was fairly crowded but we got seated right away.

The decor is interesting and the ambiance is extremely loud - there is no intimacy and conversation is very difficult.

Our waitress seemed overwhelmed - everything was very slow. At one point she came to check on us well after we had ordered and said, "How is everything? Oh, I see you don't have your desserts yet." That pretty much sums up the experience.

The desserts were OK  ... we had two orders of the warm apple crostata (it wasn't very warm) and one order of cookies and milk. We ended up taking two of the cookies with us and they were thrown away the next day.

I don't need to go back.

Good food but pricey. I enjoyed our meal, the Yelp check in offer is SPICY but delicious, would purchase next time I go, so good business tactic there. I wouldn't mind trying more food on the menu, we came late at night and sat down close to closing time, but nobody seemed to care and we got good service, but we didn't do the usual appetizer, drink, entree approach; however, the food we did have was tasty and good portions. You might feel out of place in shorts and a tshirt, so go to your room and change if you were just at the pool or something.

The food is overpriced but good!  The staff was great.  I had the short ribs.  The horseradish mash wasn't spicy at all and the habenero pickles just tasted like sweet pickles. The grilled cheese was very tasty and the fries were crisp and delicious.

My boyfriend and I dined here during happy hour and sampled just about everything. The service was absolutely excellent. Our server sent over a complimentary appetizer as well as comped our dessert as it was my birthday. The food quality, portions and prices are all great for being right on the strip. There was also a great beer menu. Also a bonus, the owner (prior Top Chef contestant) was in the restaurant the day we dined there. We would definitely go back and would recommend this restaurant to everyone.

At Laurie's birthday 11/20/2015..9:33pm. Party of 14.
My New York Steak - worse than gross. Denny's is like Mortons compared to this. I ordered medium. Barely ran past the fire.
Lobster Mac n Cheese disgusting.
Bearded Waiter - convinced this stuff was going to be good... Maybe it is sometimes.
People at our table really liked the bone marrow dish.

Crab cake was good.
Calamari was very good.

So was very excited to try this place but it fell flat. The cocktails served were just ok, the game has been uped so much in Vegas on this front that these served were just boring and lacked any craftsmanship on prepration, service or presentation. 

The food was good, not amazing, not phenomenal, it was good. 

The bartender server was not engaging, didn't introduce self and staff on our way out failed to thank or say bye. I asked what their infused liquors were and instead of telling me their offerings she (the bartender) gave me the definition of infusion... sigh.
Excellent drinks and service! Make sure to say "Hi" to Adrian at the Bar, awesome bartender!
Good service, food was great. Presentation was wonderful, small portions for the cost but overall good. Hit up the happy hour for the best value!

Malarkey's Duck Fat Fries are the best way to celebrate National French Fry Day. As always there is no better fry than a duck fat fry and these guys make some good ketchup too. Had the flank steak and jalapeno chorizo corn. Delicious. Simply, delicious.
